speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: SCENE II. The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Enter ADRIANA and LUCIANA

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Ah, Luciana, did he tempt thee so?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Mightst thou perceive austerely in his eye

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: That he did plead in earnest? yea or no?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Look'd he or red or pale, or sad or merrily?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: What observation madest thou in this case

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Of his heart's meteors tilting in his face?

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: First he denied you had in him no right.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: He meant he did me none; the more my spite.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Then swore he that he was a stranger here.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And true he swore, though yet forsworn he were.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Then pleaded I for you.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And what said he?

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: That love I begg'd for you he begg'd of me.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: With what persuasion did he tempt thy love?

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: With words that in an honest suit might move.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: First he did praise my beauty, then my speech.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Didst speak him fair?

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Have patience, I beseech.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I cannot, nor I will not, hold me still;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: My tongue, though not my heart, shall have his will.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: He is deformed, crooked, old and sere,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Ill-faced, worse bodied, shapeless everywhere;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Vicious, ungentle, foolish, blunt, unkind;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Stigmatical in making, worse in mind.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Who would be jealous then of such a one?

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: No evil lost is wail'd when it is gone.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Ah, but I think him better than I say,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And yet would herein others' eyes were worse.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Far from her nest the lapwing cries away:

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: My heart prays for him, though my tongue do curse.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Enter DROMIO of Syracuse

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Here! go; the desk, the purse! sweet, now, make haste.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: How hast thou lost thy breath?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: By running fast.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Where is thy master, Dromio? is he well?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: No, he's in Tartar limbo, worse than hell.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A devil in an everlasting garment hath him;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: One whose hard heart is button'd up with steel;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A fiend, a fury, pitiless and rough;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A wolf, nay, worse, a fellow all in buff;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A back-friend, a shoulder-clapper, one that

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: countermands

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: The passages of alleys, creeks and narrow lands;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A hound that runs counter and yet draws dryfoot well;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: One that before the judgement carries poor souls to hell.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Why, man, what is the matter?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I do not know the matter: he is 'rested on the case.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: What, is he arrested? Tell me at whose suit.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I know not at whose suit he is arrested well;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: But he's in a suit of buff which 'rested him, that can I tell.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Will you send him, mistress, redemption, the money in his desk?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Go fetch it, sister.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Exit Luciana

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: This I wonder at,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: That he, unknown to me, should be in debt.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Tell me, was he arrested on a band?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Not on a band, but on a stronger thing;

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: A chain, a chain! Do you not hear it ring?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: What, the chain?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: No, no, the bell: 'tis time that I were gone:

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: It was two ere I left him, and now the clock

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: strikes one.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: The hours come back! that did I never hear.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: O, yes; if any hour meet a sergeant, a' turns back for

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: very fear.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: As if Time were in debt! how fondly dost thou reason!

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Time is a very bankrupt, and owes more than he's

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: worth, to season.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Nay, he's a thief too: have you not heard men say

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: That Time comes stealing on by night and day?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: If Time be in debt and theft, and a sergeant in the way,

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Hath he not reason to turn back an hour in a day?

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Re-enter LUCIANA with a purse

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Go, Dromio; there's the money, bear it straight;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And bring thy master home immediately.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Come, sister: I am press'd down with conceit--

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Conceit, my comfort and my injury.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Exeunt
